gurmukhi: mhwN Awqm drsI mhwN q`q byqw ] iQrM AwsxykM mhwN aUrDryqw ]
transliteration: Mahaan Aatam Dardimahaan Tatt Betaa|| Thiran Aasnekan Mahaan Ooradhretaa||
translation: He was a great self-knowing, essence-knowing, stable Yogi performing austerities in upside down posture;

gurmukhi: krY s`iq krmM kukrmM pRnwsM ] rhY eyk ic`qM munIsM audwsM ]124]
transliteration: Darai Satt(i) Karamannd Koukaramannd Pranaasan|| Rahai Ek Chittan Mounndesan Udaasan||124||
translation: He was the destroyer of evil actions through good actions and was ever and unattached ascetic of stable mind.124.

gurmukhi: suBM SwsqR gMqw kukrmM pRxwsI ] bsY kwnnysM supwqRM audwsI ]
transliteration: Soubhan Shaastra Gadtaa Koukaramannd Pranaasee|| Basai Kaananesan Soupaatran Udaasee||
translation: He used to live in the forest, studying all Shastras, destroying evil actions as a worthy traveler on the path of detachment;

gurmukhi: qjXo kwm kRoDM sBY loB mohM ] mhwN jog j√çwlw mhw moin sohM ]125]
transliteration: Tajyo Kaam Krodhan Sabhai Lobh Mohan|| Mahaan Jog Jvaalaa Mahaa Mon(i) Sohan||125||
translation: He had forsaken lust, anger, greed and attachment and was a supreme silence-observer and the adopter of the fire of Yoga.125.

gurmukhi: krY nXws eykM AnykM pHwrI ] mhwN bHmcrjM su DrmwiDkwrI ]
transliteration: Darai Nyaas Ekan Anekan Prahdaree|| Mahaan Brahmcharjan|| Su Dharamaadhikdaree||
translation: He was the practiser of various kinds, a great celibate and an authority on Dharma;

gurmukhi: mhwN q`q byqw su sMnXws jogM ] AnwsM audwsI su bwsM ArogM ]126]
transliteration: Mahaan Tatt Betaa Su Sannyaas Jouang|| Anaasan Udaasisu Baasandarogadg||126||
translation: He was a great knower of essence, knower of the secrets of Yoga and Sannyas and a detached ascetic; he always remained in good health.126.

gurmukhi: Anwsw mhwN aurDhyqw sMnXwsI ] mhwN qq byqw AnwsM audwsI ]
transliteration: Anaasaa Mahaan Uradh-hetaa Sannyaas|| Mahaan Tat Betaa Anaasan Udaasee||
translation: He was without expectations, practiser of austerities in upside-down posture, a great knower of essence and an unattached Sannyasi;

gurmukhi: sBY jog swDY rhY eyk ic`qM ] qjY Aaur srbM ghXo eyk ih`qM ]127]
transliteration: Sabhai Jog Saadhai Rahai Ek Chittan|| Tajai Aur Saraban Gadyo Ek Hittan||127||
translation: He practiced all kinds of Yogic postures with concentration; forsaking all other desire, he meditated only on the one Lord.127.

gurmukhi: qry qwp DUmM krY pwn au`cM ] JulY m`iD AgnM qaU iDAwn mu`cM ]
transliteration: Dare Taap Dhooman Kari Paan Ouchchhan|| Jhulai Maddh(i) Agadan Taoo Dhiaan Mouchchannd||
translation: While seated near the fire and smoke, he had raised his hand and while meditating, burning the fires in all the four directions, he was internally scorching it;

gurmukhi: mhwN bHmcrjM mhwN Drm DwrI ] Bey d`q ky rudR pUrx vqwrI ]128]
transliteration: Mahaan Brahmcharjan Mahaan Dharam Dhdaree|| Bhae Datt Ke Rudra Pooran Vataari||128||
translation: He was the celibate adopting a great religion and also the perfect incarnation of Rudra.128.

gurmukhi: hTI qwpsI mon mMqRM mhwnM ] prM pUrxM d`q pRgXw inDwnM ]
transliteration: Hathitaapsimon Mantran Mahaanan|| Paran Pooranan Datt Pragyaa Nidhaanan||
translation: He was persistent silence-observer performing austerities, a great knower of mantras and the treasure of generosity;

gurmukhi: krY jog nXwsM qjy rwj BogM ] cky srb dyvM jky srb logM ]129]
transliteration: Darai Jog Nyaasan Taje Raaj Bhogadg|| Chake Sarab Devan Jake Sarab Logadg||129||
translation: While abandoning the royal enjoyments, he was practising Yoga and seeing him, all the men and hods were wonder-struck.129.

gurmukhi: jky j`k gMDRb ib`idAw inDwnM ] cky dyvqw cMd sUrM surwnM ]
transliteration: Jake Jakk Gaddhrab Biddiaa Nidhaanand|| Chake Devtaa Channd Sooran Suraanan||
translation: Seeing him, the Gandharvas, who were the treasure of science, and Chandra, Surya, the king of gods and other gods full of astonishment;

gurmukhi: Cky jIv jMqRM lKy prm rUpM ] qjXo grb srbM lgy pwn BUpM ]130]
transliteration: Chhake Jiv Jantran Lakhe Param Roopan|| Tajyo Gadab Saraban Lage Paan Bhoopan||130||
translation: All the creatures were pleased to see his comely figure and all the kings, abandoning their pride, had fallen on his feet.130.
